intro: Burseranthe pinnata, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Andes, is a striking flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has palmate leaves with a velvety texture and is often found growing in moist, shaded areas of cloud forests. Its unique appearance and cultural significance make it a notable species in botanical studies. The plant also has traditional uses in local medicine and rituals.
